definition: to have one's heart filled with/(to collide) full on/(of farm animals) heavy with young
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)

sentences.english: I loved you tenderness and candor.
sentences.chinese: 我曾柔情似水满怀真挚地爱过你。

sentences.english: He was in such a hurry to get out that he barged into a passer-by.
sentences.chinese: 他急急忙忙地往外走，竟与一位行人撞了个满怀。

sentences.english: It resides in the particular things thathe delighted to record.
sentences.chinese: 它就栖身于塞林格满怀欣喜记录下来的那些事物中。

sentences.english: With a bumper harvest in sight, joy reigned over us.
sentences.chinese: 丰收在望，我们满怀喜悦。

sentences.english: Sometimes he bent his head, as if under a great weight of sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 有时候他低着头，好象满怀愁情。

sentences.english: One of the reporters cannoned into Arnold.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个记者和阿诺德撞了个满怀。

sentences.english: That falls in well with mine, and certes brought.
sentences.chinese: 那天里，的确给我带来满怀的喜悦和舒畅。

sentences.english: He nearly ran into a large man who suddenly came in through the doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他差点与一位突然闯进的大个子男人撞个满怀。

sentences.english: She assailed her studies with new determination.
sentences.chinese: 她满怀新的决心毅然对付学习。

sentences.english: Looking to the future, we are filled with pride and enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 展望未来，我们豪情满怀。

sentences.english: Michael looked at him imploringly, eyes brimming with tears.
sentences.chinese: 迈克尔满怀乞求地看着他，两眼泪汪汪的。

sentences.english: He ran full tilt into me.
Li's pock-marked wife was also waiting for him in a subdued, humble way.
sentences.chinese: 李的麻脸妻子也在柔情满怀地等待着他。

sentences.english: To travel hopefully is better than to arrive. ----R. L.
sentences.chinese: 满怀希望的旅行比抵达目的地更美好。

sentences.english: I steer my ship with hope, leaving fear behind.
sentences.chinese: 我满怀希望地驾驶航船，把恐惧抛在后面。

sentences.english: All human wisdoms are summed up in two words: Wait and Hope.
sentences.chinese: 概言之，人类的智慧就是耐心等待并满怀希望。

definition: one's whole heart/from the bottom of one's heart
to be full of (emotion)/to brim with (love, tears etc)
to exhibit one's feelings in one's speech
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
(of tears etc) filling the eyes/(of scenery etc) filling one's field of view
hope and expectation/to anticipate/to look forward to/to await expectantly
to expect/to look forward to/anxious for sth/to hope (to get sth)
